abstract.para: Important updates to the &MESH; documentation, sorted by date, with brief descriptions of each update and when they occurred.

update.title: Implement mutual TLS authentication
update.para: You can implement mutual TLS authentication.

update.title: Region launch in af-south-1
update.para: &MESH; is now available in the af-south-1 Region.

update.title: Implement mutual TLS authentication
update.para: &preview-note; You can implement mutual TLS authentication.

update.title: Implement connection pooling for a virtual gateway listener
update.para: You can implement connection pooling for a virtual gateway listener.

update.title: Implement connection pooling and outlier detection for a virtual node listener
update.para: You can implement connection pooling and outlier detection for a virtual node listener.

update.title: Region launch in eu-south-1
update.para: &MESH; is now available in the eu-south-1 Region.

update.title: Implement connection pooling for a virtual gateway listener
update.para: &preview-note; You can implement connection pooling for a virtual gateway listener.

update.title: Implement connection pooling and outlier detection for a virtual node listener
update.para: &preview-note; You can implement connection pooling and outlier detection for a virtual node listener.

update.title: Create a virtual gateway and gateway route for mesh inbound
update.para: Enable resources that are outside of a mesh to communicate to resources that are inside of a mesh.

update.title: Add a timeout value to a virtual node listener and route
update.para: You can add a timeout value to a virtual node listener and route.

update.title: Create and manage &MESH; resources from within Kubernetes with the &MESH; controller for Kubernetes
update.para: You can create and manage &MESH; resources from within Kubernetes. The controller also automatically injects the Envoy proxy and init containers into pods that you deploy.

update.title: Add a timeout value to a virtual node listener
update.para: &preview-note; You can add a timeout value to a virtual node listener.

update.title: Create a virtual gateway for mesh inbound
update.para: &preview-note; Enable resources outside of a mesh to communicate to resources inside of a mesh.

update.title: Add a timeout value to a route
update.para: &preview-note; You can add a timeout value to a route.

update.title: Share a mesh with another account
update.para: &preview-note; You can share a mesh with another account. Resources created by any account can communicate with other resources in the mesh.

update.title: TLS encryption
update.para: &preview-note; Use certificates from an &PCAlong; or your own certificate authority to encrypt communication between virtual nodes using TLS.

update.title: Create an &MESH; proxy on an &AWS; Outpost
update.para: You can create an &MESH; Envoy proxy on an &AWS; Outpost.

update.title: HTTP/2 and gRPC support for routes, virtual routers, and virtual nodes
update.para: You can route traffic that uses the HTTP/2 and gRPC protocols. You can also add a listener for these protocols to virtual nodes and virtual routers.

update.title: Retry policy
update.para: A retry policy enables clients to protect themselves from intermittent network failures or intermittent server-side failures. You can add retry logic to a route.

update.title: TLS encryption
update.para: &preview-note; Encrypt communication between virtual nodes using TLS.

update.title: HTTP header-based routing
update.para: Route traffic based on the presence and values of HTTP headers in a request.

update.title: Availability of the &MESH; &preview-name;
update.para: The &MESH; &preview-name; is a distinct variant of the &MESH; service. The &preview-name; exposes upcoming features for you to try as they are developed. As you use features in the &preview-name;, you can provide feedback via GitHub to shape how the features behave.

update.title: &MESH; Interface VPC Endpoints (&AWS; PrivateLink)
update.para: Improve the security posture of your VPC by configuring &MESH; to use an interface VPC endpoint. Interface endpoints are powered by &AWS; PrivateLink, a technology that enables you to privately access &MESH; APIs by using private IP addresses. PrivateLink restricts all network traffic between your VPC and &MESH; to the Amazon network.

update.title: Added &CMAP; as a virtual node service discovery method
update.para: You can specify DNS or &CMAP; as a virtual node service discovery method. To use &CMAP; for service discovery, your account must have the &MESH; service-linked role.

update.title: Create &MESH; resources automatically in Kubernetes
update.para: Create &MESH; resources and add the &MESH; sidecar container images to your Kubernetes deployments automatically when you create resources in Kubernetes.

update.title: &MESH; General Availability
update.para: The &MESH; service is now generally available for production use.

update.title: &MESH; API update
update.para: The &MESH; APIs were updated to improve usability. For more information, see [FEATURE] Add Listeners to Virtual Routers and [BUG] Routes to Target Virtual Nodes with Mismatched Ports Blackhole.

update.title: &MESH; initial release
update.para: Initial documentation for service public preview
